item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_blurb: on the requirements of the Bagley-Keene Open Meeting Act. (LW-SF)

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Status and possible action on pending legislation. (KH/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Public Trust Guiding Principles & Action Plan.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and possible Commission action on 'Public Trust Guiding Principles & Action Plan.' (AY-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0852 (Gallaugher, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Tom Gallaugher to construct 50 ft. long concrete cantilevered deck addition to 45 ft. by 5 ft. cantilevered deck, resulting in 95 ft. by 5 ft. cantilevered deck; project includes relocation of gangway at 3791 Ragtime Circle, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0019 (CR Family Trust, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of CR Family Trust to construct approx. 9-ft. deep by 30-ft. wide wooden deck patio and 3-ft. high perimeter wall associated with single-family home within Newport Beach allowable beach encroachment area, at 5007 Seashore Drive Street, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0993 (Miltimore, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Diane Miltimore to remove mobile home and install new 648 sq. ft., 15 ft. high mobile home with entry stairs and handicap ramp within Seal Beach Shores Mobile Home Park at 1 Cottonwood Lane, Seal Beach, Orange County. (VL-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-23-0001-1
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend time limit for Commission action up to one year on request by the City of Laguna Beach to certify its LCP Amendment, which would modify the Implementation Plan/Title 25 to: 1) add new Emergency Shelter Overlay District to one parcel in Laguna Canyon Annexation Area Specific Plan; 2) facilitate approval of agricultural employee housing in Agriculture-Recreation and Sycamore Hills zones; and, 3) streamline approval process for housing for low income and general multifamily use in the R-3 zone. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCPA LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-22-0056-1 (Density Bonus, Lido House Hotel and Nonconforming Uses and Structures) Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend time limits for action for one year on City of Newport Beach’s request to modify and add provisions to the Coastal Land Use Plan (CLUP) and/or Implementation Plan (IP) of the City’s Local Coastal Program (LCP).  The amendment has three parts pertaining to: 1) Part A - density bonus regulation; 2) Part B - Lido House Hotel expansion; and 3) Part C – nonconforming uses and nonconforming structures.  (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-LGB-20-0058 (32007 Coast Hwy, LLC, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Mark and Sharon Fudge of City of Laguna Beach granting permit with conditions to 32007 Coast Hwy, LLC for permanent authorization of slope repair activities approved under Emergency CDP No. G-5-19-0011, including: 1) 525 cu. yd. of grading; 2) construction of soil berm; 3) various soil benching, grading, and terracing; 4) subdrains and temporary wood-lagging wall; project also includes after-the-fact approval for shoring wall with 7 caissons ranging from 30 ft. to 35 ft. in depth, after-the-fact approval for beach-access staircase associated with existing single-family home, and new shotcrete retaining wall at 32007 Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (AS-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-LGB-20-0059 (32005 Coast Hwy, LLC, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Mark and Sharon Fudge of City of Laguna Beach granting permit with conditions to 32005 Coast Hwy, LLC for permanent authorization of slope repair activities approved under Emergency CDP No. G-5-19-0011, including: 1) 525 cu. yd. of grading; 2) construction of soil berm; 3) various soil benching, grading, and terracing; 4) subdrains and temporary wood-lagging wall; project also includes after-the-fact approval for shoring wall with 3 caissons ranging from 30 ft. to 35 ft. in depth and new shotcrete retaining wall at 32005 Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (AS-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0423 (Cole Family Investment Rentals LLC, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application by Cole Family Investment Rentals LLC to remodel 1,289 sq.ft., 14’-high mobile home and construct second-story addition resulting in 2,126 sq.ft., 17’10'-high mobile home with loft, 165 sq.ft. patio cover, and 48 sq.ft. shed on beachfront mobile home space at 1880 N. El Camino Real, Unit 76, San Clemente, Orange County. (SA-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0562 (Hometown America LLC Laguna Terrace MHP, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application by Hometown America LLC to install 14.5-ft. high, 1,864 sq.ft. manufactured home, and 48 sq.ft. storage shed on 4,547 sq.ft. mobile home lot (Space K-53) within Laguna Terrace Mobile Home Park. Onsite and offsite revegetation/restoration is also proposed at 30802 South Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (MR-LB) (Note: The Commission's enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Del Mar LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-DMR-21-0081-2 (Parking Adjustments).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Del Mar to amend its certified Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan to modify the parking policies of the Land Use Plan and off-street parking requirements for restaurants and retail spaces in the Implementation Plan.

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-BRL-22-0022-1 (Barrio Logan Community Plan Update) Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of San Diego to adopt a comprehensive update to the certified Barrio Logan Community Plan (LUP) to separate land uses and provide new public space amenities and mobility options; and amend the Land Development Code (IP) to remove the Barrio Logan Planned District Ordinance, adopt city-wide zones, add a community overlay implementation zone to establish a transition between industrial port and residential areas, and add inclusionary housing requirements and dwelling unit protections for existing residents.  (ML-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 6-22-0748 (National City Bayshore Bikeway Segment 5, National City)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of National City to construct Segment 5 of the Bayshore Bikeway, consisting of 1.45-mile long, up to 15-ft. wide Class 1 Bikeway. On-street development includes new traffic signals, crosswalks, curbs and ramps, lane re-striping, wayfinding signage, 8-ft. high retaining walls. Off-street development includes 4-ft. high fencing, a 4-ft. high, 50-ft. long retaining wall, adjacent to Paradise Marsh in National City, San Diego County.
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 6-22-1034 (University of California San Diego (UCSD) Ridge Walk North Student Housing Project, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of UCSD to demolish multiple structures totaling 131,741 sq.ft. and construct 4 mixed-use residential-dining-academic buildings 6 to 18 stories high totaling approximately 926,487 sq. ft. on a 21-acre site on West Campus, southwest of Voigt Drive and Hopkins Lane, La Jolla, San Diego, San Diego County.
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: At a convenient time during the meeting, the Commission (CCC) will have a closed session to discuss items of pending litigation, including:

item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL
There will be no General Public Comment today. If you wish to speak during the public comment period, please submit a request to speak during public comment on Friday’s agenda.

item_blurb: Briefing on the status of offshore wind development in federal waters offshore of California’s north and central coasts. (KH-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 2-22-0004 (Surf Schools, Pacifica)
subitem_blurb: Application by City of Pacifica to fully authorize a Surf Camp/Surf School Program, including an application and licensing scheme, at Pacifica State (Linda Mar) Beach, in the City of Pacifica, San Mateo County. (EM-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Permit Amendment No. 2-15-1357-A2 (San Francisco Public Utilities Commission Armoring, Ocean Beach)
subitem_blurb: Request by San Francisco Public Utilities Commission to amend permit to extend authorization period for existing armoring and erosion control measures by one year (to July 1, 2024) all located seaward of Great Highway and south of Sloat Boulevard and fronting the City’s Oceanside Wastewater Treatment Facility and related infrastructure in the southern portion of the City of San Francisco near Fort Funston in San Francisco County.  (JKN-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-STC-23-0005-1-Part A (Small Housing Units). Time Extension Only
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on extension of time limit to act on request by City of Santa Cruz to amend the LCP Implementation Plan to clarify Single Room Occupancy (SRO) unit regulations and to rename Small Ownership Units (SOUs) as Flexible Density Units (FDUs) and amend their standards. (KF-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. A-3-SCO-20-0027 (Sisney, Santa Cruz Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Bret and Carol Sisney to demolish o approx. 6,000 sq.ft. single-story home and construct new 2-story approx. 8,200 sq.ft. home and lap pool; merger of two lots (out of four contiguous lots under common ownership); and related development on blufftop above beach and ocean and fronted by vertical seawall, at 4660 Opal Cliff Drive in unincorporated Opal Cliffs area of Santa Cruz County. (NC-SC) (Note: The Commission's enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and/or this site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. A-3-STC-22-0018 (Oversized Vehicle Parking Restrictions, Santa Cruz)
subitem_blurb: Application of the City of Santa Cruz to prohibit parking of oversized vehicles citywide on public streets, rights-of-way, and parking lots between midnight and 5am; provide alternative overnight parking areas and services for such displaced vehicles; and implement related measures within the City of Santa Cruz, Santa Cruz County. (KF-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0880 (O’Neal, Long Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of John O’Neal to remove and replace 440 sq.ft. floating dock and 212 sq.ft. pier like for like; 3 ft. by 20 ft. gangway to remain, decking to be replaced; five 14-in. piles to remain at 5665 E. Sorrento Dr., Long Beach, Los Angeles County. (EG-LB)

item_title: DEPUTY DIRECTOR’S REPORT for ENERGY, OCEAN RESOURCES and FEDERAL CONSISTENCY
item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.

subitem_title: Application A-3-SLO-04-035-A1 (Pacific Gas and Electric Company, San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Pacific Gas and Electric Company to modify existing independent spent fuel storage installation (“ISFSI”) to accommodate horizontal storage casks within the current ISFSI and power plant boundaries, at Diablo Canyon Nuclear Power Plant, P.O. Box 56, Avila Beach (approximately six miles north of Avila Beach), County of San Luis Obispo.

subitem_title: Application No. 9-22-0733 (City of Ventura, Ventura Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by City of Ventura to construct approx. 6,800-ft.-long ocean outfall, pump station, and associated onshore conveyance pipeline as well as the discharge of tertiary-treated effluent from Ventura Water Reclamation Facility through outfall and the future discharge of concentrate produced from a pending Advanced Water Treatment Facility, City of Ventura, Ventura County. (WH-SF)

subitem_title: Consistency Determination No. CD-0009-22 (U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and International Boundary and Water Commission)
subitem_blurb: Consistency determination by U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and International Boundary and Water Commission for improvement of wastewater treatment including the expansion of an existing wastewater treatment capacity, upgrade in wastewater collection systems, and construction of a 35-million gallon per day Advanced Primary Treatment Plant for ocean discharge, San Diego County (CT-SF).

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.
subitem_title: Informational Update on Caltrans Highway 101 Last Chance Grade Permanent Restoration Project
subitem_blurb: Informational update by Caltrans on the status of the upcoming Last Chance Grade Permanent Restoration Project involving alternatives that include, but are not limited to, reengineering the existing roadway, constructing a series of retaining walls, and/or constructing a 10,000-ft.-long tunnel along a 3.5-mile-long section of U.S. Highway 101 in Del Norte County (post mile 12.0 to 15.5) within Redwood National and State Parks from about 9 miles south of Crescent City to Wilson Creek.

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: Application No. 4-21-0498 (City of Oxnard, The Nature Conservancy, and California Coastal Conservancy, Oxnard)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Oxnard, The Nature Conservancy, and California Coastal Conservancy to implement five-year maintenance and habitat conservation program consisting of year-round and seasonal fencing to protect nesting shorebirds, remove invasive plant species and tree trimming, maintenance of existing access roads and trails by clearing overgrown vegetation, and field data collection and monitoring activities including to install groundwater monitoring wells, water level and salinity gauges, and time-lapse photographic monitoring stations, at Ormond Beach, City of Oxnard, Ventura County. (JH-V)

subitem_title: Application No. 4-22-0020 (Cicileo, Santa Barbara Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Michael Cicileo to restore, with appropriate native habitat, areas impacted by unpermitted development, and undertake additional habitat restoration; remove unpermitted fill, and retain some unpermitted fill for access purposes; and remove obstructions to public access at property located at 5300 Shoreline Drive, in Santa Barbara County. (SF-V) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Application 5-21-0558-A1 (Michaelson, Venice)
subitem_blurb: Request by Andrea Michaelson to amend previously approved permit to demolish single-family home and construct new single-family home to reduce size of new home resulting in new 2-story, 29’-4’’ high, 2,598 sq.ft. single-family home with three onsite parking spaces, at 212 Sherman Canal, Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (BW-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS
